title: Swap GameHud layout: score right, timer left, prompt middle
description: Rearrange the three GameHud items: move score to the right, timer to the left, and prompt in the middle.

title: Landing page carousel with game mode screenshots
description: Replace the 'try the game' button on the landing page with a carousel showing a screenshot of each game mode. Screenshots taken with default settings, 12 areas into game progress.

title: Make game seed available to user
description: Game seed must currently be input into query parameter by the user, and no explanation is available regarding its 8 character requirement. Resolves GitHub #10.

title: Move seed from URL query param to game settings (localStorage)
description: Remove seed from URL query parameter. Store it in game settings, persisted to localStorage via existing saga.

title: Add seed input to settings modal
description: Add input field to GameSettings that accepts exactly 8 alphanumeric characters as the game seed.

title: Display current seed in GameHUD
description: Show the current seed (or 'undefined' if none set) to the right of score in GameHUD.

title: Add predefined seeds dropdown
description: Add a dropdown with predefined seeds: dickbutt, kumquats, oslobest.

title: Route Mode
description: Epic for the Route Mode game mode. Player navigates from point A to point B by clicking through intersections on the map. Scored by comparing player's route time (Google Maps Compute Routes API) to optimal route time. See GitHub issue #59 for full spec.

title: Route mode: add 'route' to GameMode type and settings constants
description: Add 'route' to the GameMode union in settingsTypes.ts. Add entry to MODE_OPTIONS and MODE_DESCRIPTIONS in consts.ts. Disable difficulty selector for route mode (like click mode). This is the foundational type change that all other route mode work depends on.

title: Route mode: landing page carousel slide and settings panel
description:
Add route mode to entry points:
- GameModeCarousel.tsx: new slide in SLIDES array with mode: 'route'
- GameSettings.tsx: route mode option visible, difficulty disabled for route mode (extend the existing disabled guard that currently checks mode !== 'name')
- Redux reducer: ensure gameSettings handles route mode correctly (no area-specific settings needed)
Carousel slide needs an image/visual — can be placeholder initially.

title: Route mode: define route-specific types
description:
Define types for route mode state and data:
- RouteAddress: { name, roadName, lat, lng } for start/end points
- RouteDecision: intersection selection record (undo-ready array design)
- RouteGameState: discriminated union or interface for the 3 states (at-start, at-intersection, at-end)
- RouteResult: player route time, optimal time, difference, game time
These types should live in a route-specific types file under game/ (e.g., game/routeTypes.ts or game/route/types.ts).

title: Route mode: hardcoded Oslo address list and seeded pair selection
description: Create a list of 5-10 default RouteAddress entries for Oslo. Implement seeded random pair selection (consistent with existing seed system in useGameState). The pair selection should use the game seed to deterministically pick two addresses from the list as start and end points.

title: Route mode: intersection graph cache and road fetching logic
description:
Build the client-side road data cache that grows as the player progresses. Core logic:
- Maintain a Record<string, RoadInfo> cache that accumulates fetched road data
- On game start: fetch starting road (fetchRoadWithIntersections from api/roadData.ts)
- On intersection selection: fetch newly reachable roads not yet in cache
- Branching road indexes are already available from prior fetches (so UI can show dots immediately while full data loads)
- Expose available intersections for the current position based on cached data
This is the data engine that powers the gameplay — should be a custom hook (e.g., useRoadGraph or useRouteData).

title: Route mode: game state machine hook (useRouteMode)
description:
Core game logic hook for route mode. Manages:
- State machine: at-start → at-intersection → ... → at-end
- Decision history as an array (undo-ready but no undo in v1)
- Available intersections at current position (derived from road graph cache)
- Direction commitment: selecting an intersection hides dots behind it
- End point detection: destination becomes selectable when its road appears as an intersecting road at the current intersection
- Exposes: currentState, availableIntersections, selectedRoute (array of lat/lng), handleIntersectionClick, isComplete, resetRouteState
Analogous to useGameState but for route mode — doesn't use GameEntry or polygon features.

title: Route mode: map rendering — intersection dots, markers, and route polyline
description:
Map visualization during gameplay:
- Start marker (A) and end marker (B) always visible
- Intersection dots: white/off-white circles on available roads, expand on hover, turn blue when selected and stay visible
- Blue polyline drawn through selected intersections as player progresses
- Default zoom fits both A and B, player can pan/zoom freely
- Dots behind a committed direction disappear
This is separate from polygon-based useGameStyling — route mode uses polylines + dot markers (likely AdvancedMarkerElement or custom overlays).

title: Route mode: Google Maps Compute Routes API integration
description:
API layer for route scoring. Two calls needed at game end:
1. Compute Routes API: A → B direct (optimal route time)
2. Compute Routes API with waypoints: A → player's intersections → B (player's route time)
Possibly Snap to Roads API to match OSM intersection coords to Google Maps road data (evaluate if needed — may be redundant).
API key already set up. Add new functions to api/ layer. Return structured result: playerRouteTime, optimalRouteTime, difference.

title: Route mode: results screen (split view)
description:
Results screen shown when player reaches destination. Split view layout:
Left panel (map): player's route in blue, Google Maps optimal route in green, both overlaid.
Right panel (stats): player's route time, optimal route time, time difference, time spent in game, play again button.
Triggers Compute Routes API calls on game completion. Reuses useGameTimer for time spent.

title: Route mode: integrate into Game.tsx and GameHUD/GameUI
description:
Wire route mode into the existing game component tree:
- Game.tsx: conditional rendering based on mode === 'route' — skip useFeaturesInPlay/useGameStyling, use route-specific hooks instead
- GameHUD: route mode prompt text branch, reuse timer
- GameUI: route mode branch (no name input, route-specific controls if any)
- useGame.ts: compose useRouteMode + useGameTimer when mode === 'route'
- Ensure same lifecycle: lobby → playing → results (isGameActive / isComplete flags)

title: Add difficulty setting with autocomplete for name mode
description: Add difficulty setting: 'easy' and 'hard'. For now only affects name mode. Easy → input has autocomplete dropdown for areas in current game. Hard → no autocomplete.

title: Route Mode v2
description: Epic for the Route Mode game mode (v2 breakdown). Player navigates from A to B by clicking intersections. Scored by comparing player route time to Google Maps optimal. See GitHub #59.
notes: Supersedes route-mode label beads (frontend-5qs.*). References GitHub issue #59.

description: Add route mode to entry points: GameModeCarousel.tsx new SLIDES entry (mode: 'route'), GameSettings.tsx route option with difficulty disabled, Redux reducer handles route mode. Carousel slide can use placeholder image initially.

title: Define route-specific types
description: Define types: RouteAddress (name, roadName, lat, lng), RouteDecision (intersection selection, undo-ready array), RouteGameState (discriminated union: at-start | at-intersection | at-end), RouteResult (playerRouteTime, optimalTime, difference, gameTime). Place in game/route/types.ts or similar.

title: Hardcoded Oslo address list and seeded pair selection
description: Create 5-10 RouteAddress entries for Oslo. Implement seeded random pair selection consistent with existing seed system in useGameState. Deterministically pick start/end from the list based on game seed.

title: Intersection graph cache and road fetching hook
description: Custom hook (useRoadGraph or useRouteData) managing client-side Record<string, RoadInfo> cache. On game start: fetch starting road via fetchRoadWithIntersections. On intersection selection: fetch newly reachable roads not yet cached. Expose available intersections for current position.

title: Route mode game state machine hook (useRouteMode)
description: Core game logic hook. Manages state machine (at-start → at-intersection → at-end), decision history array (undo-ready, no undo in v1), available intersections, direction commitment (hide dots behind selected intersection), end detection (destination selectable when its road intersects current position). Exposes: currentState, availableIntersections, selectedRoute, handleIntersectionClick, isComplete.

description: Map visualization during gameplay: A/B markers always visible, white/off-white intersection dots on available roads (expand on hover, blue when selected), blue polyline through selected intersections, default zoom fits A+B. Separate from polygon-based useGameStyling — uses polylines + dot markers.

title: Google Maps Compute Routes API integration
description: API layer for route scoring at game end. Two Compute Routes API calls: (1) A→B direct for optimal route time, (2) A→waypoints→B using player's intersections for player route time. Evaluate if Snap to Roads API is needed for OSM→Google coord matching. Return structured RouteResult.

title: Route mode results screen (split view)
description: Split view on game completion. Left: map with player route (blue) and optimal route (green) overlaid. Right: player route time, optimal time, difference, time spent, play again button. Triggers Compute Routes calls on completion. Reuses useGameTimer.

title: Integrate route mode into Game.tsx, GameHUD, GameUI
description: Wire route mode into component tree: Game.tsx conditional rendering (skip useFeaturesInPlay/useGameStyling, use route hooks), GameHUD route prompt text, GameUI route branch (no name input). Compose useRouteMode + useGameTimer. Same lifecycle: lobby → playing → results.

title: Track and display time used
description: Timer starts when player enters game, resets on settings reset. Display on right side of GameHUD mirrored to prompt. Stops when last area is clicked.

title: Add game mode descriptions (carousel + settings tooltip)
description: Show a short description for each game mode. In the landing page carousel, include it as part of each slide. In settings, show it as a tooltip on the mode buttons.

title: Clean up name mode input
description: Polish the name mode text input UX: styling, autocomplete behavior, keyboard navigation, difficulty levels, and HUD cleanup.

title: Style name mode input like Google Maps search bar
description: Make the input white/opaque with shadow and rounded corners, inspired by Google Maps search input. Keep the existing red/blue border flashing for correct/incorrect feedback. Ignore Google Maps' button and icons — only take inspiration from the broader design and color scheme.

title: Show autocomplete only after first character typed
description: No suggestions should appear until at least one character has been typed. No expand button — suggestions only display when the input has content and matches exist.

title: Sort autocomplete suggestions alphabetically
description: Sort the autocomplete suggestion list by area name (alphabetical).

title: Preview hovered suggestion in input, resume typing from previous text
description: When hovering or keyboard-navigating suggestions, display the hovered/selected item text in the input. If the user continues typing after hovering, resume from where they left off (their last typed text), not from the hovered suggestion text.
notes: Depends on frontend-czm.2 (custom dropdown replaces native datalist)

title: Flash target area with non-disruptive blue pulse pattern
description: The highlighted/prompting area on the map should flash blue in a subtle, non-disruptive repeating pattern so the player can easily spot which area to name.

title: Tab key selects first suggestion or focuses input
description: When the input is focused and Tab is pressed: select the first suggestion if available, otherwise do nothing (no default tab behavior). When the input is not focused and Tab is pressed in name mode: focus the input instead of default tab behavior.
notes: Depends on frontend-czm.2 (custom dropdown replaces native datalist)

title: Add medium difficulty with city-wide suggestions
description: Add a 'medium' difficulty option between easy and hard. Easy shows suggestions from the area pool in play. Medium shows suggestions from all areas in the city. Hard shows no suggestions. Update DIFFICULTY_OPTIONS and validation accordingly.

title: Add tooltips to difficulty setting buttons
description: Add title tooltips to difficulty buttons describing each level: easy — suggestions from the area pool in play, medium — suggestions show all areas from city, hard — no suggestions.
notes: Depends on frontend-czm.7 (medium difficulty must exist first)

title: Remove seed display from GameHUD
description: Remove the seed text from the HUD score area. Seed is still in settings but no longer shown during gameplay.

title: Display name of incorrectly clicked area
description: When clicking the wrong area, show the user which area they actually clicked. Resolves GitHub #13.

title: Implement name mode gameplay
description: In 'name' mode, player types the name of a highlighted area instead of clicking. Input replaces prompt position in Game UI (not HUD). Auto-focused on game start. On submit: case-insensitive check. Correct → clear input, flash green outline. Wrong → flash red outline, keep text. Register correct/wrong same as click mode.

title: Rename MODE_OPTIONS to AREA_COUNT
description: Current 'modes' (MODE_OPTIONS) are actually area count options. Rename to AREA_COUNT throughout the codebase to free up 'mode' for the new name/click game mode setting.

title: Make predefined seeds common memes (frontend)
description: Swap predefined seeds to dickbutt, pepefrog, rickroll. Display meme icons instead of string values. Rickroll opens Rick Roll YouTube tab, calls increment_rickroll_counter API, displays Rick Astley gif + counter in place of GameHud until settings close.

title: Center labels on actual polygon center instead of GeoJSON point centroid
description: Labels are currently centered towards the bulk of the GeoJSON points, not the actual center of the polygon. Need to compute proper polygon centroid for label placement.

title: Hide header/footer in game unless settings are open
description: Header and footer should only show when the settings modal is open in game view. Header should overlap the settings button so it feels contained within the header. GameHud may need a slight downward shift when header is visible to remain unobstructed.

title: Implement name mode
description: Add a 'name' game mode where players type area names instead of clicking. Includes HUD rearrangement, mode/difficulty settings, landing page carousel, and mode descriptions. See GitHub issue #25.

title: Add mode setting with name and click options
description: Add a 'mode' setting to GameSettings with two options: 'name' and 'click'. 'click' is the current default behavior.
